dataset_id: SAFARI 2000 Physical and Chemical Properties of Aerosols, Dry Season 2000
title: SAFARI 2000 Physical and Chemical Properties of Aerosols, Dry Season 2000
summary: SAFARI 2000 provided an opportunity to study aerosol particles produced by savanna burning. We used analytical transmission electron microscopy (TEM), including energy-dispersive X-ray spectrometry (EDS) and electron energy-loss spectroscopy (EELS), to study aerosol particles from several smoke and haze samples and from a set of cloud samples. These aerosol particle samples were collected using the University of Washington Convair CV-580 research aircraft (Posfai et al., 2003).
